title: Add static filter favorites with "Not Closed" default
description: Initial implementation of filter favorites. Add a dropdown with static preset filter combinations, defaulting to "Not Closed".
design:
**Implementation:**
1. Add favorites dropdown next to "+ Filter" button
2. Static presets:
   - "All" - no filters
   - "Not Closed" - status: open, in_progress, blocked (default)
   - "Active" - status: in_progress, blocked
3. On load, apply "Not Closed" preset
4. Selecting a preset replaces current filters
5. Manual filter changes clear the preset selection (show as "Custom")

**UI placement:**
`[Favorites ‚ñæ] [+ Filter] [Clear]`

Or integrate into existing filter UI as first option in the filter menu.
acceptance_criteria:
- Favorites dropdown visible in filter toolbar
- "Not Closed" applied by default on panel load
- Selecting preset updates filter chips
- Clear button resets to "All"

title: Filter presets/favorites system for Issues panel
description: Currently filtering requires manually adding multiple filters (e.g., Open + In Progress + Blocked to exclude Closed). Need a better UX for common filter combinations.
design:
**Options considered:**

1. **Preset filters** - Built-in presets like "Not Closed", "Active Work"
   - Simple UX, covers common cases
   - Limited flexibility

2. **Negated filters** - Click to toggle +/- on any filter
   - Full flexibility
   - More complex UX, needs visual indicator

3. **Default filter** - Start with a filter applied (e.g., "Not Closed")
   - Good for most common use case
   - User can clear if needed

**Recommended approach:**
Combination of 1 + 3: Filter "favorites" dropdown that preconfigures filter sets.
- Start with static built-in favorites: "Not Closed", "Active" (in_progress + blocked), "All"
- Future: Allow saving custom filter sets as favorites
- Default to "Not Closed" on load

title: Fix bd sync prefix mismatch (vscode-beads- vs vscode-)
description: bd sync fails with: "prefix mismatch detected: database uses 'vscode-beads-' but found issues with prefixes: [vscode- (16 issues)]". This prevents syncing beads to git.
design:
Error suggests using --rename-on-import flag. May need to:
1. Run bd sync --rename-on-import
2. Or fix the prefix in config.yaml
3. Or re-export with correct prefix
notes:
**Root Cause:** Bug in `internal/utils/issue_id.go:ExtractIssuePrefix` - used `strings.Index` (first hyphen) instead of `strings.LastIndex` (last hyphen). For `vscode-beads-4n2`, it extracted prefix as `vscode` instead of `vscode-beads`.

**Fix:** Already in beads main (commit 6294ef0c). New bd built at `/tmp/bd-new`.

**Workaround Applied:** Renamed prefix from `vscode-beads` to `vsbeads`.

title: Redesign Dashboard for compactness and usefulness
description: Current dashboard has redundant/space-wasting sections. The status bar chart duplicates the summary cards above. Need a more compact, meaningful layout.
design:
**Keep:**
- Summary cards (Total, Ready, In Progress, Blocked) - useful at a glance
- In Progress list - very useful

**Remove/Replace:**
- Status breakdown bars (redundant with cards)
- Priority breakdown bars (takes too much space)

**Options for compact redesign:**

**Option A: Type + Priority chips**
```
[Summary Cards Row]

BY TYPE          BY PRIORITY
bug: 3           P1: 1  P2: 4  P3: 3
feature: 4
task: 1

IN PROGRESS      BLOCKED (if any)
- issue...       - issue...
```

**Option B: Single stats row**
```
[Summary Cards Row]

Types: üêõ3  ‚ú®4  üìã1    Priority: P1:1 P2:4 P3:3

IN PROGRESS      READY (top 3)
- issue...       - issue...
```

**Option C: Kanban-lite summary**
```
[Summary Cards Row]

READY (3)        IN PROGRESS (2)   BLOCKED (0)
- issue...       - issue...        (none)
- issue...       - issue...
```

Recommendation: Option C - shows actionable items, no redundancy

title: viewContainer/title buttons not showing in BEADS header
description: Configured beads.switchProject and beads.refresh commands in viewContainer/title menu with `when: viewContainer == beads`, but no buttons appear in the BEADS header. Only the [...] overflow menu shows.
design:
Current config in package.json:
```json
"viewContainer/title": [
  {
    "command": "beads.switchProject",
    "when": "viewContainer == beads",
    "group": "navigation"
  },
  {
    "command": "beads.refresh", 
    "when": "viewContainer == beads",
    "group": "navigation"
  }
]
```

Commands have icons defined ($(folder) and $(refresh)).

Things to try:
- Full VS Code quit/restart (not just reload)
- Check if viewContainer context is being set correctly
- Try without "when" clause
- Check VS Code version compatibility
